verses.kjv: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;
verses.ct: So then, holy brothers and sisters who share in the heavenly calling, focus your attention on Jesus Christ — the Apostle and High Priest of the faith we declare.

verses.kjv: Who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also Moses was faithful in all his house.
verses.ct: He was faithful to the one who appointed him, just as Moses was faithful in all of God's household.

verses.kjv: For this man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house.
verses.ct: But Jesus has been considered worthy of greater glory than Moses, in the same way that the builder of a house receives more honor than the house itself.

verses.kjv: For every house is builded by some man; but he that built all things is God.
verses.ct: Every house is built by someone, but the one who built everything is God.

verses.kjv: And Moses verily was faithful in all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after;
verses.ct: Moses was truly faithful in all of God's household as a servant, pointing ahead to the things that would be revealed later.

verses.kjv: But Christ as a son over his own house; whose house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end.
verses.ct: But Christ is faithful as a Son placed over God's household — and we are that household, as long as we hold firmly to our confidence and the joy of our hope all the way to the end.

verses.kjv: Wherefore (as the Holy Ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his voice,
verses.ct: That is why, as the Holy Spirit says: 'Today, if you hear his voice,

verses.kjv: Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:
verses.ct: don't harden your hearts like your ancestors did during the rebellion, on the day of testing in the wilderness,

verses.kjv: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.
verses.ct: where your ancestors tested me and challenged me, even though they watched what I did for 40 years.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in their heart; and they have not known my ways.
verses.ct: Because of this, I was angry with that generation and said, "Their hearts are always going astray, and they have never understood my ways."

verses.kjv: So I sware in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest.)
verses.ct: So in my anger I made an oath: "They will never enter my rest."'

verses.kjv: Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.
verses.ct: Be careful, brothers and sisters, that none of you develops a sinful, unbelieving heart that turns away from the living God.

verses.kjv: But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.
verses.ct: Instead, encourage each other every day, while it is still called "Today," so that none of you becomes hardened by the deception of sin.

verses.kjv: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast unto the end;
verses.ct: Because we have become partners with Christ, but only if we hold on to the confidence we had at the beginning all the way to the end.

verses.kjv: While it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.
verses.ct: As it has been said: 'Today, if you hear his voice, don't harden your hearts like your ancestors did during the rebellion.'

verses.kjv: For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.
verses.ct: Now, who were the ones that heard and still rebelled? Wasn't it all the people Moses led out of Egypt?

verses.kjv: But with whom was he grieved forty years? was it not with them that had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?
verses.ct: And who was God angry with for 40 years? Wasn't it those who sinned, whose bodies dropped in the wilderness?

verses.kjv: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that believed not?
verses.ct: And to whom did he swear that they would never enter his rest? It was those who refused to trust him.

verses.kjv: So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.
verses.ct: So we can see that they were unable to enter because of their unbelief.
